snippet: According to most female prisoners interviewed by a correctional group, New York State prison guards regularly violate department policy and state law on handling prisoners giving birth.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes accounts from women who gave birth while incarcerated in New York State claiming they were shackled during labor, despite 2009 ban on restraining inmate in labor; survey of 27 women reveals that 23 participants reported being restrained; accounts conflict with official records showing that women were not bound.
lead_paragraph: According to most female prisoners interviewed by a correctional group, New York State prison guards regularly violate department policy and state law on handling prisoners giving birth.

headline.print_headline: A Banned Practice for Pregnant Inmates Is Said to Persist
headline.main: Restraint of Pregnant Inmates Is Said to Persist in New York Despite Ban
